alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:26PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Randolph County through 530 PM CDT... At 425 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fosters Cross Roads, or near Lake Wedowee, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke, Wedowee, Lake Wedowee, Woodland, Morrison Cross Roads, Fosters Cross Roads, Crystal Lake, Corinth, Newell, Ofelia, Napoleon, Tennant, Rock Mills, Big Springs, Paran, Rock Stand and R.L. Harris Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
